00064 #if (RETARGET_PORT == RETARGET_ITM)
00065 #define ITM_PORT8(n)    (*((vu8 *)(0xE0000000 + 4 * n)))
00066 #define ITM_PORT16(n)   (*((vu16 *)(0xE0000000 + 4 * n)))
00067 #define ITM_PORT32(n)   (*((vu32 *)(0xE0000000 + 4 * n)))
00068 
00069 #define DEMCR           (*((vu32 *)(0xE000EDFC)))
00070 #define TRCENA          (0x01000000)
00071 volatile int32_t ITM_RxBuffer = ITM_RXBUFFER_EMPTY; /* For Keil MDK-ARM only                                */
00072 #endif

00096 struct __SEGGER_RTL_FILE_impl {         // NOTE: Provides implementation for FILE
00097   int stub; // only needed so impl has size != 0.
00098 };
00099 static FILE __SEGGER_RTL_stdin_file  = { 0 };  // stdin reads from UART
00100 static FILE __SEGGER_RTL_stdout_file = { 0 };  // stdout writes to UART
00101 static FILE __SEGGER_RTL_stderr_file = { 0 };  // stderr writes to UART
00102 
00103 FILE *stdin  = &__SEGGER_RTL_stdin_file;  // NOTE: Provide implementation of stdin for RTL.
00104 FILE *stdout = &__SEGGER_RTL_stdout_file; // NOTE: Provide implementation of stdout for RTL.
00105 FILE *stderr = &__SEGGER_RTL_stderr_file; // NOTE: Provide implementation of stderr for RTL.

00118 void RETARGET_Configuration(void)
00119 {
00120 #ifdef RETARGET_IS_UART
00121   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00122      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00123      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00124   */
00125   USART_InitTypeDef USART_InitStructure;
00126   #ifdef RETARGET_UxART_BAUDRATE
00127   USART_InitStructure.USART_BaudRate = RETARGET_UxART_BAUDRATE;
00128   #else
00129   USART_InitStructure.USART_BaudRate = 115200;
00130   #endif
00131   USART_InitStructure.USART_WordLength = USART_WORDLENGTH_8B;
00132   USART_InitStructure.USART_StopBits = USART_STOPBITS_1;
00133   USART_InitStructure.USART_Parity = USART_PARITY_NO;
00134   USART_InitStructure.USART_Mode = USART_MODE_NORMAL;
00135 
00136   #ifdef RETARGET_COM_PORT
00137   HT32F_DVB_COMInit(RETARGET_COM_PORT, &USART_InitStructure);
00138   #else
00139   { /* Enable peripheral clock of UxART                                                                     */
00140     CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00141     CKCUClock.Bit.RETARGET_UxART_IPN        = 1;
00142     CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00143   }
00144 
00145   USART_Init(RETARGET_USART_PORT, &USART_InitStructure);
00146   USART_TxCmd(RETARGET_USART_PORT, ENABLE);
00147   USART_RxCmd(RETARGET_USART_PORT, ENABLE);
00148   #if (RETARGET_INT_MODE == 1)
00149   NVIC_EnableIRQ(RETARGET_UART_IRQn);
00150   #endif
00151   #endif
00152 #endif
00153 
00154 #if (RETARGET_PORT == RETARGET_ITM)
00155   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00156   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO       = 1;
00157   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00158 
00159   CKCU_MCUDBGConfig(CKCU_DBG_TRACE_ON, ENABLE);
00160   AFIO_GPxConfig(TRACESWO_GPIO_ID, TRACESWO_AFIO_PIN, TRACESWO_AFIO_MODE);
00161 #endif
00162 
00163 #ifdef NON_USB_IN_APP
00164   SERIAL_USBDInit();
00165 #endif
00166 }

00168 int __backspace(FILE *stream)
00169 {
00170   if (stream == 0) // Remove the compiler warning
00171   {
00172   }
00173   return 0;

00176 /*
00177   Keil and IAR before 9.20 share fputc() to implement printf
00178 */
00179 int fputc (int ch, FILE *f)
00180 {
00181   #if 0
00182   if (f == 0) // Remove the compiler warning
00183   {
00184   }
00185   #endif
00186   #if (RETARGET_PORT == RETARGET_ITM)
00187   if (DEMCR & TRCENA)
00188   {
00189     while (ITM_PORT32(0) == 0);
00190     ITM_PORT8(0) = ch;
00191   }
00192   return (ch);
00193   #else
00194   #ifdef AUTO_RETURN
00195   if (ch == '\n')
00196   {
00197     SERIAL_PutChar('\r');
00198   }
00199   #endif
00200   return (SERIAL_PutChar(ch));
00201   #endif
00202 }
00203 
00204 #if defined (__ICCARM__)
00205 #if (__VER__ > 9010000)
00206 /*
00207   IAR's version after 9.20 use write to implement printf
00208 */
00209 int __write(int Handle, 
00210             const unsigned char * Buf, 
00211             int Bufsize)
00212 {
00213   size_t nChars = 0;
00214   if (Handle == -1)
00215   {
00216     return 0;
00217   }
00218   /* Check for stdout and stderr
00219      (only necessary if FILE descriptors are enabled.)  */
00220   if (Handle != 1 && Handle != 2)
00221   {
00222     return -1;
00223   }
00224   for (/*Empty */; Bufsize > 0; --Bufsize)
00225   {
00226     SERIAL_PutChar(*Buf++);
00227     ++nChars;
00228   }
00229   return nChars;
00230 }
00231 #endif
00232 int __read(int Handle, unsigned char *Buf, size_t BufSize)
00233 {
00234   #if (RETARGET_PORT != RETARGET_ITM)
00235   int nChars = 0;
00236 
00237   if (Handle != 0)
00238   {
00239     return -1;
00240   }
00241 
00242   for (/* Empty */; BufSize > 0; --BufSize)
00243   {
00244     unsigned char c = NULL;
00245     c = SERIAL_GetChar();
00246     if (c == 0)
00247       break;
00248     *Buf++ = c;
00249     ++nChars;
00250   }
00251   #endif
00252   return nChars;
00253 }
00254 
00255 #elif defined(__SES_ARM)
00256 #if defined(__SEGGER_RTL_VERSION)
00257 /*
00258   SES's version after 6.20 use RTL to implement printf.
00259 */
00260 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00261  * @brief Get character from standard input..
00262  * @retval Character received.
00263  ************************************************************************************************************/
00264 static char _stdin_getc(void) {
00265   unsigned char c;
00266 
00267   if (_stdin_ungot != EOF) {
00268     c = _stdin_ungot;
00269     _stdin_ungot = EOF;
00270   } else {
00271     c = SERIAL_GetChar();
00272   }
00273   return c;
00274 }
00275 
00276 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00277   * @brief Get file status.
00278   * @param Pointer to file.
00279   * @retval -1: Failure, stream is not a valid file. 0: Success, stream is a valid file.
00280   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00281 int __SEGGER_RTL_X_file_stat(FILE *stream) {
00282   if (stream == stdin || stream == stdout || stream == stderr) {
00283     return 0;       // NOTE: stdin, stdout, and stderr are assumed to be valid.
00284   } else {
00285     return EOF;
00286   }
00287 }
00288 
00289 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00290   * @brief  Get stream buffer size.
00291   * @param  stream: Pointer to file.
00292   * @retval Nonzero number of characters to use for buffered I/O; for unbuffered I/O, return 1.
00293   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00294 int __SEGGER_RTL_X_file_bufsize(FILE *stream) {
00295   (void)stream;
00296   return 1;
00297 }
00298 
00299 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00300   * @brief  Read data from file.
00301   * @param  stream: Pointer to file to read from.
00302   * @param  s: Pointer to object that receives the input.
00303   * @param  len: Number of characters to read from file.
00304   * @retval -1: Failure, stream is not a valid file. >0: Success, stream is a valid file.
00305   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00306 int __SEGGER_RTL_X_file_read(FILE *stream, char *s, unsigned len) {
00307   int c;
00308 
00309   if (stream == stdin) {
00310     c = 0;
00311     while (len > 0) {
00312       *s = _stdin_getc();
00313       ++s;
00314       ++c;
00315       --len;
00316     }
00317   } else {
00318     c = EOF;
00319   }
00320   return c;
00321 }
00322 
00323 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00324   * @brief  Write data to file.
00325   * @param  stream: Pointer to file to write to.
00326   * @param  s:Pointer to object to write to file.
00327   * @param  len:Number of characters to write to the file.
00328   * @retval -1: Failure, stream is not a valid file. >0: Success, stream is a valid file.
00329   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00330 int __SEGGER_RTL_X_file_write(FILE *stream, const char *s, unsigned len) {
00331   if ((stream == stdout) || (stream == stderr)) {
00332     //BSP_UART_WriteBlocking(_UART_Port, (const unsigned char*) s, len);
00333     for (/*Empty */; len > 0; --len)
00334     {
00335       SERIAL_PutChar(*s++);
00336     }
00337     return len;
00338   } else {
00339     return EOF;
00340   }
00341 }
00342 
00343 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00344   * @brief  ush character back to stream.
00345   * @param  stream: Pointer to file to push back to.
00346   * @param  c: Character to push back.
00347   * @retval -1: Failure, stream is not a valid file. >0: Success, stream is a valid file.
00348   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00349 int __SEGGER_RTL_X_file_unget(FILE *stream, int c) {
00350   if (stream == stdin) {
00351     if (c != EOF && _stdin_ungot == EOF) {
00352       _stdin_ungot = c;
00353     } else {
00354       c = EOF;
00355     }
00356   } else {
00357     c = EOF;
00358   }
00359   return c;
00360 }
00361 #endif
00362 #else
00363 int fgetc (FILE *f)
00364 {
00365   #if 0
00366   if (f == 0) // Remove the compiler warning
00367   {
00368   }
00369   #endif
00370   #if (RETARGET_PORT == RETARGET_ITM)
00371   /* For Keil MDK-ARM only                                                                                  */
00372   while (ITM_CheckChar() == 0);
00373   return (ITM_ReceiveChar());
00374   #else
00375   return (SERIAL_GetChar());
00376   #endif
00377 }
00378 #endif
00379 
00380 void _ttywrch(int ch)
00381 {
00382   #if (RETARGET_PORT == RETARGET_ITM)
00383   if (DEMCR & TRCENA)
00384   {
00385     while (ITM_PORT32(0) == 0);
00386     ITM_PORT8(0) = ch;
00387   }
00388   #else
00389   SERIAL_PutChar(ch);
00390   #endif
00391 }
00392 #endif

00394 void _sys_exit(int return_code)
00395 {
00396   if (return_code == 0) // Remove the compiler warning
00397   {
00398   }
00399 
00400 label:  goto label;  /* endless loop                                                                        */
00401 }
